Motivation

  • Experiment.
  • Have fun.
  • Keep it simple.
  • Build a product.

https://goo.gl/ZNuMvy

JavaScript

  • ECMAScript 1: Jun 1997
  • ECMAScript 2: Aug 1998
  • ECMAScript 3: Mar 2000
  • ECMAScript 4: Proposal on Oct 2007
  • ECMAScript 5.1(aka ES5) : Jun 2011
  • ECMAScript 6 (aka ES6, ES 2015): Jun 2015
  • ECMAScript 7 (aka ES7): June 2016

Compatibility

https://github.com/lukehoban/es6features

Challenges

  • Migrating code from ES5 to ES6.
  • Keep your taxonomy simple.
  • Avoid complex build systems.
  • Avoid boilerplate code.
  • Class definitions.
  • Class inheritance.

Other challenges

  • Project got bigger.
  • Forgetting stuff.
  • Linting was not enough.

See: Game git repo history

TypeScript

  • First 0.8.0: Oct 2012
  • 1.1.0.1: Oct 2014
  • 1.8 Beta: Jan 2016
  • 1.8 Beta: Jan 2016
  • 2.0.3: Sept 2016
  • 2.3.4: May 2017

npm install -g typescript

Anders Hejlsberg

He was the original author of Turbo Pascal and the chief architect of Delphi.
He currently works for Microsoft as the lead architect of C# and core developer on TypeScript.
From Wikipedia.

Source: Delphi1 easter eggs

  • superset of ES6
  • static typing
  • class based OOP
  • transpiles or transcompiles
  • open-source

TypeScript Playground

class_inheritance_ts.html class_inheritance_statics_ts.html

Setup

https://github.com/serbanghita/TypeScript-Builds

CommonJS, AMD, SystemJS, ES6 modules
  • Client-side modules require a build step.
  • Everything started from the module pattern.
  • Beware of circular dependencies

browserify.org / webpack.github.io

require('modules') in the browser

browserify src/game.ts --debug -p tsify -o dist/js/game.src.js

Compare TypeScript with Flow
